cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSE of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest today, then turning north and making landfall along the central Louisiana coast before moving inland up the Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near the Intracoastal City–Morgan City area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron (includes Lake Charles area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City to Cameron for Tropical-Storm conditions
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from the Upper Texas coast across Louisiana to coastal Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph gusts) possible Saturday into early Sunday with a 50% chance of sustained 34 kt winds and a 13% chance of 50 kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible, generally below 3 ft, as Lake Charles area lies just west of the 3–5 ft surge warning zone.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 inches, locally higher, leading to flash and river flooding along the Calcasieu River and port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands and prolonged river flooding that could hamper port operations and landside transport links.
